elements.text: [Part One]
Spaceship landing. Beeps and unintelligible voices on comms.
Monan time vessel initiating materialisation sequence.
(a woman) If you mean, it's landing, Ensac, please, can't you just say so?
Shields reactivated, Monitor.
My name is Trinkett. Please, Ensac, how many more times. Forget the Monitor stuff when it's just the two of us.
Yes, Mon, I mean. I'll try.
Hmm. Inform our glorious leader his last visitors are arriving.
High Minister, this is Assistant Monitor Ensac in Central Control. Monan Host arrival imminent. Please proceed to berthing bay.
This is Monitor Trinkett. Ceremonial escort to berthing bay confirm. I said, confirm.
[OC]: Confirm, Control.
The Minister will do the welcome bit. Just stand by to take them straight to the delegate's relaxation rooms, blue route. Confirm.
[OC]: Same old routine. Confirm.
Then you can go off shift. Enjoy. Out.
Monan Host vessel materialising now. Repeat Monan
Hardly seems real, does it?
What, twenty of the greatest powers in Space Time
Yes, that. If we mess up here, it's not just our careers on the line. It could be
The end of civilisation as we know it?
Or as we knew it. Or as we will know it. That's the wonderful thing about time travel capability, isn't it? You never know when retribution might pop along.
Monitor, they can't still think Archetryx had anything to do with
Alarms.
Tell me that isn't.
It is. Gravity wells again. Registering massive discharge.
Damn it!
Eight point four, eight point seven. The largest surge yet.
Isolate cause.
Interference across all frequencies. Scan breakdown.
Engineering, this is Central Control. Report to gravity wells immediately. Immediately!
The Tardis materialises. Tardis door opens.
Oh. Anyone would think you travelled in a cocktail shaker, not a Police box. What was that we went through?
That, Evelyn, was some kind of temporal disturbance. As if, well, as if something very large was tearing through the Vortex.
And we got caught up in its wake.
If you like. Wonder where we are now?
I can tell you that. Boring old corridor.
Insightful, certainly, but perhaps a more thorough investigation is in order, hmm?
Distorted voices.
What's that?
One way to find out.
Walking.
Panicking beings.
Please, delegates, I beseech you to remain calm.
We were fools to entrust our safety to the people of Archetryx.
There is no cause for alarm, Delegate. This is merely a minor (glass breaks) matter. In any
case, nothing can penetrate our defensive shield.
Are you absolutely certain of that?
We seem to have slipped through happy as Larry.
Intruders!
It's rude to point, you know.
Guards!
Commander Vorna, please.
Oh, no. What's he doing here?
Doctor? Who is it?
Allow me a moment to explain, Commander, please. (continues under dialogue.)
Coordinator Vansell. He's a Time Lord.
Like you.
Not like me. He's a member of the Celestial Intervention Agency, self-serving and avaricious.
He seems to be saving our necks right now.
So he can slip a noose about them himself. I wonder.
Power overload stabilising. Whew. Levels reducing.
Did the engineers
They had nothing to do with it, Monitor.
Engineering, report.
[OC]: (Scottish, of course) I'm not sure there's anything we can do here. The readouts are well within normal tolerance now.
Check the power feeds anyway. I want a full report. Out. Damn things need a complete overhaul. Why will no one listen to me?
The High Minister did inspect the instrumentation banks personally only yesterday.
Interfering busybody. Anyway, the problem's not in the instrumentation banks, anyone can see that.
Beep! Angry sounds on comms.
Uh oh. Looks like Vorna's got her hands full in the Delegates suite. You'd better get down there and. Wait.
Burbling, beeping.
Ensac, we have a full record of every individual attending this conference?
Of course, Mon, er, I mean
So who are those two?
I must apologise on behalf of the President of the High Council of Time Lords, Commander.
Can't he do it himself?
Delegate Vansell, as you are well aware, these people have no authority to be present at the conference.
As I say, I must apologise, but the President never travels anywhere without his er, his personal staff.
Personal staff?
He simply never thought to declare them.
I feel like duty free.
You must understand. If the other powers assembled here discover the Time Lords are (pause) reinterpreting etiquette.
I am telling you the pure and simple truth, Commander. (continues under dialogue.)
Got to admire his bare-faced cheek.
Essential character attribute for the Celestial Intervention Agency. Normally they're a pretty shadowy bunch, but for Vansell here to be escorting the President?
Just what is this conference about?
Control must be informed, and the High Minister.
Of course.
I'd quite like to be further informed myself.
Ah, here's the High Minister now. And that man's from Control, isn't he? Please, Commander Vorna, inform away.
Evelyn, go with her. There's something wrong here, I can feel it.
In your bones or in your water?
Which reminds me. Subtlety and discretion to be employed at all times.
Naturally. See you later, Doctor.
Doctor, I must speak with you immediately.
And I you. Personal staff indeed.
Hubbub of voices.
A moment please, High Minister. (sotto) Vorna, who are these people?
The Doctor and Miss
Evelyn.
Are personal secretaries to the Time Lord President.
And no one thought to tell us? Get her over to Control and get the two of them processed before Trinkett goes berserk.
Yes, Ensac. Evelyn, will you accompany me?
Lead on.
Three beeps.
Delegates, I present the High Minister of Archetryx, together with our final arrival, Delegate Nahal of the Monan Host.
We commit ourselves to the ideals of the Temporal Treaty.

Well said, my friend Monan. Please accept my humblest apologies on behalf of all Archetryx for any distress the recent tremors may have afforded you. There is categorically no cause for alarm. This was an entirely natural phenomenon of no consequence.
Door opens and closes.
Your sense of timing is appalling, Doctor.
I'm thrilled to see you, too.
Quickly, in here. Our quarters. We can talk safely here.
Door opens and closes.
But first I'll have your eyesore of a Tardis translocated to the berthing bay before the High Minister stumbles upon it and has a seizure.
Well, be careful. The old girl's just been rattled by some kind of chronic disturbance.
Slipstream from the Monan Host ship, no doubt. Their engines are strong enough. You probably picked it up when you slipped through shields with them.
But we didn't. We've only just arrived. But speaking of Monans, what was all that about a Temporal Treaty?
Door opens.
Doctor.
Lord President. What an unexpected surprise to find you here. With him.
Well, now that you're here, I supposed we'd better put you in the picture.
Yes. Since when did Gallifrey seek the approval of other time-travelling races?
There are weightier issues that concern us.
Are there indeed? Well?
Your address went very well, High Minister.
Thank you, Ensac.
Choking, high pitched tone.
High Minister, are you all right?
(weak) You will help me to my quarters, Assistant Monitor Ensac.
Of course.
Quickly.
You've heard of Etra Prime, Doctor?
The oldest planetoid in the universe, Lord President? Dreary little rock, of course. It wound up in the vicinity of the Archetryx system, didn't it?
For most of recorded time it has been of little interest to anyone except occasional planetary geologists, until a seam of minerals unique in the known universe was discovered deep in the substrata.
How fascinating.
It became fascinating, Doctor, when it was found that the minerals responded in ways
contrary to the laws of physics. Archetryx opened Etra Prime to a host of interested parties in exchange for furthering their own scientific knowledge.
The people of Archetryx had limited time travel capabilities. We gave them some assistance.
I see. Well, was it worth it?
Fifty powers had representatives on Etra Prime. There were some five hundred lifeforms engaged in top secret research unlocking the energies in these new materials, when (coughs) Forgive me.
Take these, Lord President.

Oh, my pills. Thank you. I should not be here now, Doctor. I serve an interim role until the fate of (coughs). Presidents have come and gone since I retired from office, but my advice is still sought from time to time. It really can be a nuisance, you know.
I quite understand, Lord President, but er, the point?
Barely into her first term of office, the then President was on Etra Prime for an official visit when er
The planetoid vanished.
Vanished?
It was taken out of time and space, along with all personnel. There have been sporadic sightings of it rumoured since, but er
Did you follow them up?
To no avail.
A year after Etra Prime vanished, three hundred corpses were discovered here on Archetryx, riddled with time distortion.
You can imagine the outcry. There was almost war, but Archetryx denied all knowledge.
I take it your new President was among those dead?
No, Doctor. Romanadvoratrelundar remains missing.
Romana?
Door opens.
Ah, there you are, Vorna.
This is Evelyn, Monitor Trinkett. One of the President's
I know. Ensac told me. Now, your registration details, Delegate Evelyn.
Oh, what a lovely bracelet you're wearing.
It's a wrist communicator, Delegate Evelyn. We all wear them.
Oh. Oh yes. There's Vorna's. Silly me. Still, pretty and functional. That's good. That's really very. Er, shouldn't you switch off your alarm clock?
Something beeping.
Damn. That's a. No, that can't be right.
Very rapid beeping.
Ensac, report to Control immediately. Ensac, confirm.
What's the problem?
Where is he? We're registering some kind of gravitational disturbance.
Where?
Our sector of space, only a few parsecs from here.
Some kind of attack?
No, it's too big to be a spaceship.
Would now be a good time to check your defences are working properly?

Shields functioning normally, except the power levels. Well, Ensac's the expert. Ensac, this is Control. Respond please. I think, I think our phantom planet's back again. Repeat, I think Etra Prime's come back to haunt us.
[OC]: Ensac, please respond. Ensac, please respond.
High Minister, please. If you're feeling better now, I must report to Monitor Trinkett.
No, Ensac, you must listen to me. Listen to me, Ensac.
High pitched tone.
What's that noise?
Don't resist it, Ensac.
No.
You will obey a higher power from now on, just as I do.
But when did Etra Prime vanish, Lord President?
(sighs) Twenty years ago now.
Oh. Oh, Romana. Talk about the frying pan and the fire. From E-Space into. Anyway.
Still no satisfactory explanation for the planetoid's disappearance has been found.
And why not, Vansell? With all the dirtiest Time Lord tricks at your disposal, I'd have thought by now
Etra Prime has been taken out of Time altogether.
Something far beyond Archetryx's capabilities.
The rulers of Archetryx have offered up their world to inspection and instigated this conference.
It is hoped that agreement can be reached on the limitation of Time manipulation among these emergent planetary powers.
Oh, I thought as much. You're here to protect your own mystique, and to make sure no one's getting too big for their boots. But what about finding Etra Prime, eh? What about finding Romana?
This conference gives us the perfect opportunity to learn who here possesses the capability to remove a world from Time altogether, and thus a step closer to finding the guilty party.
Oh, splendid. It's taken you twenty years to get that far, has it? And as you say yourself, your plan does rather depend on the guilty party being here at all.
At the very least, Doctor, we may find a clue.
And in the meantime any insight into alternative Time technologies will do you very nicely.
Vansell may have his own agenda, but mine is to discover the truth. Who can have done this, Doctor? Who would risk the wrath of so many galactic powers?
Who indeed. Wait. Of course. That chronic disturbance I mentioned. Vansell, what it if was Etra Prime making one of its fleeting reappearances?
The thought had occurred to me.
Then we must find out for sure. Come on, man. Quickly!
We'd better join your friend in Central Control.
Beeping, door opens.
Unit seven reporting.
2: You may approach the Black Dalek.
Speak.
Etra Prime now approaching Archetryx.
Has the Archetryxan agent been prepared for our purpose?
He obeys without question.
The time grows near. Soon the Daleks will attain their greatest triumph.
Door opens.
Ensac, about time. Where the hell have you been?
You are picking up some kind of signal, Monitor?
I think it's Etra Prime.
Impossible, Monitor.
Trinkett. How many more times? Drop the Monitor. Oh well, never mind. Look, I checked. It's in the same region as those rogue sightings that were logged.
Your readings are wrong, Trinkett.
What?
The instrumentation is faulty.
Well, the mass seems low.
I must power down the instrumentation panel.
Clicking switches. Power drops.
Ensac. But you've shut down the external scanners now too, and the shield controls.
I, I must check the instrumentation.
Ensac, are you all right?
Yes, Trinkett.
Look, just get it sorted, okay? Quick.
(sotto) I will do as I have been instructed.
Hubbub of voices.
No sign of him here. He obviously doesn't fancy the delegatesâ€™ buffet.
All right, let's split up. We'll look less conspicuous.
Right. I'll take the west wing, shall I?
We'll meet back in twenty minutes.
Is that space minutes or good old-fashioned Earth minutes?
I'm sorry?
Oh, never mind. Twenty whatevers. See you then. Excuse me. Thank you, Yes, primitive Earth woman coming through. Oh, aren't you an interesting colour. Goodness.
[OC]: Vorna. Vorna, Ensac's turned up. Get yourself back here.
But I've just sent
[OC]: Now, Vorna. I need you here. There's something not right.
(sotto) Look, just move it, Vorna, okay?
Switches still clicking, and continues behind dialogue.
You're sure that's absolutely necessary, Ensac?
It is necessary.
Door opens and closes.
(sotto) That's all I need. (normal) May I help you, Delegate Vansell, and Delegate?
I'm known as the Doctor, although I imagine I may be known by some slightly more colourful names around here, Mizz?
Doctor, this is Monitor Trinkett.
Ah.
Well, personnel restrictions do apply to Time Lords too. You've placed us in a difficult position, Delegate Doctor.
For which I cannot apologise enough, so I shan't even start. Now, tell me, Monitor Trinkett, have you noticed anything untoward in this sector of space recently?
Well
Something planet sized?
How could you?
Then Etra Prime has returned.
No. It's impossible. I thought there was something out there, but the instruments are faulty.
Faulty?
Must be. Anyway, the object's mass didn't correlate to our records of Etra Prime.
So it's been thoroughly mined. Anything else?
It was moving too fast to be a planet.
What do you mean, moving?
Ridiculous, isn't it. It was heading this way.
Piloted.
So the detectors must be faulty, right?
And your young friend there would be fixing them?
Ensac's the expert.
I must do as I have been instructed.
Must you, indeed.
So effectively you're saying we're blind here.
Better than trusting to faulty detectors.
I wonder what they'd be showing you now?
Well, he's not in Engineering.
Door opens.
Oops. Goodness.
Door closes.
Who's this, then?
I obey.
(sotto) Who do you obey, I wonder, Mister Highly Suspicious Minister?
Beeping.
Berthing bay access requires authorisation code. (beeps) Thank you, High Minister. Code accepted.
Bulkhead opens.
(sotto) And what can you be after in there?
Door opens and closes.
Monitor Trinkett, I came as soon as I could.
All right, Vorna, not in front of the delegates. I'm pretending everything's fine.
You mean it isn't?
I don't know, but if the Time Lords get wind of any problems
Perhaps I could give you a hand, Ensac? I'm quite proficient at this sort of thing.
I must complete the repairs.
Oh, come on now, I can help.
Leave me alone! (thump)
Oh, steady!
Ensac, get off him! What are you doing?
Fighting.
That's enough, Ensac.
Vorna, restrain him!
Punch, thud.
Oh. For such a slight girl, Vorna, you pack quite a wallop.
Consider Ensac restrained, Monitor.
That probe. He was going to put a hole in your head.
I had noticed.
Delegates, I can't apologise
Don't. I think it's more important to see what he was up to.
Ensac groans.
He's coming round.
Ensac?
I must carry out my instructions.
Whose instructions? Well?
2: Units are nearing target undetected.
Our agent is in position in the berthing bay.
2: Archetryx in range in twenty rels.
Victory for the Daleks is assured.
Where's he gone now? Inconsiderate devil. How does he expect me to see what he's up to in the dark?
The device is in position, master.
Device? That sounds nasty, and it looks. Oh, my God!
Ensac's wrecked the scanners and altered the shield settings in some way.
What do you mean?
Well, they're jammed on.
I don't understand. Ensac, were you trying to keep something out?
Or all of us in?
Must carry out my instructions.
Could he perhaps be moved somewhere soundproofed? I need to think. If I can get the external detectors functioning.
We need to know who he's working for.
He's not working for anyone. This is an internal security matter, Delegate Vansell.
Power builds.
Ah! There we are. (beeps) Oh no.
What is it?
Right outside. The detectors are picking up lifesigns.
What? How many?
Nearly thirty. If I can just get visual back online.
No. No.
I can't just hide back here. Excuse me, Minister. What are you doing here? What is that thing?
I obey, master.
It's a bomb, isn't it? You let off that thing, you'll bring the walls down on us.
Detonation imminent.
Get away from there! Come on!
Running. Boom! Evelyn cries out. Crashing debris.
Secure the berthing bay. Crush resistance. Proceed to Engineering section. Exterminate all personnel. Proceed! Proceed!
Alarm sounding.
What was that?
[OC]: Exterminate. Exterminate.
Look. Look at the screens.
What are those things?
Daleks. The most ruthless forms of life in the universe. Will I never be rid of them?
Daleks.
Ensac? He's dead.
The Daleks had no further use for him.
Then the Daleks must possess Etra Prime, and they're steering it towards us.
[OC]: Please, anyone.
Evelyn?
That's the general address system. She must be in
[OC]: I'm in the berthing bay. The High Minister is dead.
The High Minister? Oh, this is crazy.
[OC]: He set of some kind of bomb, and now metal creatures are pouring in from outside. I'm trapped here by debris. Please someone be hearing this.
We've got to get her out of there.
This is so screwed up. Vorna, get going. Guards! (under dialogue) All guards, to the berthing bay immediately. Immediately. This is not a drill.
Don't worry, Doctor. I'll make sure she's safe.
I'm going with you, Vorna.
You can't go, Doctor.
I'd advise you, Vansell, to let go of me immediately.
Repeat, this is not a drill.
If Etra Prime is on its way here, we must know what we're up against. That's not my area of expertise.
I can't just leave Evelyn.
I'll send our own Chancellery Guards down there. We'll get her out.
As long as / get us out of this mess.
You're wasting time, Doctor.
Door opens.
Guards. All guards, full alert get down to the berthing bay now. Full combat status.
Door closes.
Weapons fire and explosions. Screams.
Warning, humanoid counter-offensive. We are under attack.
Here comes the cavalry. Over here! Come on, shift, can't you? I'm stuck over here. Please.
Exterminate.
Oh God, I wasn't talking to you.
Energy weapon, boom. Dalek gurgles.
Thank you. Commander Vorna. What on Earth are these things?
Daleks.
I take it they're not on the guest list.
Boom!
That came from Engineering.
Vorna, your people must fall back.
But surely we have to hold them here?
In case it escaped your notice, the Daleks just wiped out Engineering. They've got further than we. Look out!
Dalek weapon.
Exterminate.
Energy weapon.
Can your lot hold them?
I don't know. I don't know!
Anything coming through from Etra Prime?

Not yet. I'm broadcasting a distress signal on all frequencies, but Daleks don't make for the most sympathetic audience. Oh, I see. It seems the Daleks have shut down our external communications links.
We're completely cut off?
I'm afraid so.
[OC]: This is Vansell.
Evelyn?
[OC]: She's safe. Vorna has her.
Oh, good work. Good work, Vorna.
[OC]: Trinkett, they've destroyed the Engineering complex. All personnel dead. Now they seem to be regrouping here. More reinforcements arriving now. Quite a mixture.
Look after Evelyn for me.
[OC]: I think she thinks she's looking after me. Out.
All my engineers.
Oh, I'm sorry.
I just can't believe that the High Minister could sabotage what we've been planning so long.
The Daleks could have many agents in your government.
At least it explains why he was personally inspecting the shields yesterday.
Allowing the Task Force safe passage, yes. But why enter via the berthing bay, I wonder? And why regroup there now instead of attacking?
Like fixing the shields and fixing the engineers. It must be to stop us leaving.
But then the Daleks are trapped here too. The shields are temporal in nature, I take it?
Right. Everything inside the barrier exists a good minute in the future. It's all powered by the gravity wells.
Of course, the key to your time travel.
Even they've been playing up.
Really? What, that disturbance earlier?
We can't understand why, but the power surges have always been within safety tolerance, just about, so no one's been bothered.
Hmm. Well, Ensac's done too good a job of wrecking the shield controls here. With Engineering out. I have to see the gravity wells. Perhaps we can manipulate the shields from there.
You expect me to open the wells to, to an outsider?
We're all outsiders to the Daleks, and we'll all surely die together unless you give me access.
All right. Come on.
The Daleks could take us easily. Why are they staying put with just a few sentries to stop us getting too near?
It's like they're searching for something.
Something like that big grey box, by the look of it.
Of course. The Monan Host ship, the most powerful vessel here. We have to stop them.
You want them to stay?
If the shields are jammed on, how can they?
That's the one ship here that might bypass them. The Monan craft is still at a fairly embryonic stage, but our observations suggest their power supply's phenomenal. Like nothing we possess.
Not that that had anything to do with your attending the conference. Planning a little snooping were we?
Wait. What are they
They can't all fit inside. Not dimensionally transcendental, then. Did you see how many got in?
Eight, maybe?
Makes you feel better, does it, Vansell? Happy camper now?
Whirring noise.
They're doing it. They're breaking free.
Whirring noise gets louder then fades away.
That technology in the Dalek's hands.
It should have been Gallifrey's.
If it's any consolation, there's still about twenty Daleks who missed the bus.
And here they come.
Dalek weapons fire.
Black Dalek to Monan time vessel. Report status.
[OC]: Power systems breached. Initial tests suggest power source ninety one percent probability to penetrate shields.
As predicted.
[OC]: Commencing dematerialisation.
Hurry. The temporal drive is needed here on Etra Prime.
Here, you'll need this survival suit.
Hmm. Expecting inclement weather?
It's pitch black in the gravity wells. Dangerous. They're vast, full of energies we barely understand.
And something else. While you were fetching the suits I diverted some of these scanner links to monitor the interior of the wells.
I didn't know they could do that.
They can't. I had to ask your computer very nicely. We need some idea of the basic layout if we're to tamper a little.
What did you find?
That there's a high level of impurity registering.
Does that matter? We can still manipulate the gravity fields without out what it is, can't we?
Don't like mysteries. One lot of bodies was dumped on the surface of Archetryx.
You think
I don't want to, but with the Daleks here and Etra Prime moving closer by the second, this may be my last chance to learn what's happened to Romana.
Romana?
My, my friend.
Monan vessel to Black Dalek on Etra Prime.
[OC]: Report.
Shields still holding.
[OC]: Increase drive to maximum power.
Maximum power.
Alarms.
Shields giving way.
[OC]: You will breach the barriers. Nothing can resist the Daleks!
Uh oh. The Daleks are getting restless.
They're fanning out. Is it an attack?
They're not even watching us. Out of here, quickly! Everyone out. Those Daleks approaching, they're going to self-destruct!
What?
Running. Boom! Boom! Boom! More debris falling.
Tell me, are you Time Lords right about everything?
Oh, what a mess. We'll never shift that lot.
The Daleks have made sure we're staying here. I must tell the President.
And the other delegates. Come on.
I'm going to try and find the Doctor.
Bulkhead door opens and closes. Heavy footsteps.
So, these are your gravity wells.
It's zero gravity once beyond the safety zone. Use your boot clamps.
Ah, yes.
There should be an inspection ladder down here.
Down into the darkness. I'm glad the torch is working. Ah, a sign. No unqualified personnel beyond this point. Splendid. Here we go then.
Down ladder.
Doctor.
Yes?
I think I heard something.
Imagination, I hope.
No, listen.
Scraping sound.
Oh, what was that? Urgh!
Trinkett, I
Squealing.
Now it's on my back!
What is?
Well, you've got the torch. Urgh, it's trying to burrow into my suit.
Let me see. No, back up the ladder, Trinkett, quickly.
What are they?
Dalek mutants. The creatures inside the travel machines, operating independently in the zero gravity.
Why? How?
So they can attack more urgh! effectively.
The air's thick with them.
We have to get out of here, Trinkett. Move! Up the ladder, quickly!
I, I can't they're all over me! Doctor!

parts.searchable_dialogue:
ENSAC: Monan time vessel initiating materialisation sequence.
TRINKETT: (a woman) If you mean, it's landing, Ensac, please, can't you just say so?
ENSAC: Shields reactivated, Monitor.
TRINKETT: My name is Trinkett. Please, Ensac, how many more times. Forget the Monitor stuff when it's just the two of us.
ENSAC: Yes, Mon, I mean. I'll try.
TRINKETT: Hmm. Inform our glorious leader his last visitors are arriving.
ENSAC: High Minister, this is Assistant Monitor Ensac in Central Control. Monan Host arrival imminent. Please proceed to berthing bay.
TRINKETT: This is Monitor Trinkett. Ceremonial escort to berthing bay confirm. I said, confirm.
SECURITY: [OC]: Confirm, Control.
TRINKETT: The Minister will do the welcome bit. Just stand by to take them straight to the delegate's relaxation rooms, blue route. Confirm.
SECURITY: [OC]: Same old routine. Confirm.
TRINKETT: Then you can go off shift. Enjoy. Out.
COMPUTER: Monan Host vessel materialising now. Repeat Monan
TRINKETT: Hardly seems real, does it?
ENSAC: What, twenty of the greatest powers in Space Time
TRINKETT: Yes, that. If we mess up here, it's not just our careers on the line. It could be
ENSAC: The end of civilisation as we know it?
TRINKETT: Or as we knew it. Or as we will know it. That's the wonderful thing about time travel capability, isn't it? You never know when retribution might pop along.
ENSAC: Monitor, they can't still think Archetryx had anything to do with
TRINKETT: Tell me that isn't.
ENSAC: It is. Gravity wells again. Registering massive discharge.
TRINKETT: Damn it!
ENSAC: Eight point four, eight point seven. The largest surge yet.
TRINKETT: Isolate cause.
ENSAC: Interference across all frequencies. Scan breakdown.
TRINKETT: Engineering, this is Central Control. Report to gravity wells immediately. Immediately!
EVELYN: Oh. Anyone would think you travelled in a cocktail shaker, not a Police box. What was that we went through?
DOCTOR: That, Evelyn, was some kind of temporal disturbance. As if, well, as if something very large was tearing through the Vortex.
EVELYN: And we got caught up in its wake.
DOCTOR: If you like. Wonder where we are now?
EVELYN: I can tell you that. Boring old corridor.
DOCTOR: Insightful, certainly, but perhaps a more thorough investigation is in order, hmm?
EVELYN: What's that?
DOCTOR: One way to find out.
VORNA: Please, delegates, I beseech you to remain calm.
MONAN: We were fools to entrust our safety to the people of Archetryx.
VORNA: There is no cause for alarm, Delegate. This is merely a minor (glass breaks) matter. In any
VORNA: case, nothing can penetrate our defensive shield.
DOCTOR: Are you absolutely certain of that?
EVELYN: We seem to have slipped through happy as Larry.
VORNA: Intruders!
DOCTOR: It's rude to point, you know.
VORNA: Guards!
VANSELL: Commander Vorna, please.
DOCTOR: Oh, no. What's he doing here?
EVELYN: Doctor? Who is it?
VANSELL: Allow me a moment to explain, Commander, please. (continues under dialogue.)
DOCTOR: Coordinator Vansell. He's a Time Lord.
EVELYN: Like you.
DOCTOR: Not like me. He's a member of the Celestial Intervention Agency, self-serving and avaricious.
EVELYN: He seems to be saving our necks right now.
DOCTOR: So he can slip a noose about them himself. I wonder.
ENSAC: Power overload stabilising. Whew. Levels reducing.
TRINKETT: Did the engineers
ENSAC: They had nothing to do with it, Monitor.
TRINKETT: Engineering, report.
ENGINEER: [OC]: (Scottish, of course) I'm not sure there's anything we can do here. The readouts are well within normal tolerance now.
TRINKETT: Check the power feeds anyway. I want a full report. Out. Damn things need a complete overhaul. Why will no one listen to me?
ENSAC: The High Minister did inspect the instrumentation banks personally only yesterday.
TRINKETT: Interfering busybody. Anyway, the problem's not in the instrumentation banks, anyone can see that.
TRINKETT: Uh oh. Looks like Vorna's got her hands full in the Delegates suite. You'd better get down there and. Wait.
TRINKETT: Ensac, we have a full record of every individual attending this conference?
ENSAC: Of course, Mon, er, I mean
TRINKETT: So who are those two?
VANSELL: I must apologise on behalf of the President of the High Council of Time Lords, Commander.
EVELYN: Can't he do it himself?
VORNA: Delegate Vansell, as you are well aware, these people have no authority to be present at the conference.
VANSELL: As I say, I must apologise, but the President never travels anywhere without his er, his personal staff.
DOCTOR: Personal staff?
VANSELL: He simply never thought to declare them.
EVELYN: I feel like duty free.
VORNA: You must understand. If the other powers assembled here discover the Time Lords are (pause) reinterpreting etiquette.
VANSELL: I am telling you the pure and simple truth, Commander. (continues under dialogue.)
EVELYN: Got to admire his bare-faced cheek.
DOCTOR: Essential character attribute for the Celestial Intervention Agency. Normally they're a pretty shadowy bunch, but for Vansell here to be escorting the President?
EVELYN: Just what is this conference about?
VORNA: Control must be informed, and the High Minister.
VANSELL: Of course.
DOCTOR: I'd quite like to be further informed myself.
VANSELL: Ah, here's the High Minister now. And that man's from Control, isn't he? Please, Commander Vorna, inform away.
DOCTOR: Evelyn, go with her. There's something wrong here, I can feel it.
EVELYN: In your bones or in your water?
DOCTOR: Which reminds me. Subtlety and discretion to be employed at all times.
EVELYN: Naturally. See you later, Doctor.
VANSELL: Doctor, I must speak with you immediately.
DOCTOR: And I you. Personal staff indeed.
ENSAC: A moment please, High Minister. (sotto) Vorna, who are these people?
VORNA: The Doctor and Miss
EVELYN: Evelyn.
VORNA: Are personal secretaries to the Time Lord President.
ENSAC: And no one thought to tell us? Get her over to Control and get the two of them processed before Trinkett goes berserk.
VORNA: Yes, Ensac. Evelyn, will you accompany me?
EVELYN: Lead on.
ENSAC: Delegates, I present the High Minister of Archetryx, together with our final arrival, Delegate Nahal of the Monan Host.
MONAN: We commit ourselves to the ideals of the Temporal Treaty.
MINISTER: Well said, my friend Monan. Please accept my humblest apologies on behalf of all Archetryx for any distress the recent tremors may have afforded you. There is categorically no cause for alarm. This was an entirely natural phenomenon of no consequence.
VANSELL: Your sense of timing is appalling, Doctor.
DOCTOR: I'm thrilled to see you, too.
VANSELL: Quickly, in here. Our quarters. We can talk safely here.
VANSELL: But first I'll have your eyesore of a Tardis translocated to the berthing bay before the High Minister stumbles upon it and has a seizure.
DOCTOR: Well, be careful. The old girl's just been rattled by some kind of chronic disturbance.
VANSELL: Slipstream from the Monan Host ship, no doubt. Their engines are strong enough. You probably picked it up when you slipped through shields with them.
DOCTOR: But we didn't. We've only just arrived. But speaking of Monans, what was all that about a Temporal Treaty?
PRESIDENT: Doctor.
DOCTOR: Lord President. What an unexpected surprise to find you here. With him.
VANSELL: Well, now that you're here, I supposed we'd better put you in the picture.
DOCTOR: Yes. Since when did Gallifrey seek the approval of other time-travelling races?
PRESIDENT: There are weightier issues that concern us.
DOCTOR: Are there indeed? Well?
ENSAC: Your address went very well, High Minister.
MINISTER: Thank you, Ensac.
ENSAC: High Minister, are you all right?
MINISTER: (weak) You will help me to my quarters, Assistant Monitor Ensac.
ENSAC: Of course.
MINISTER: Quickly.
PRESIDENT: You've heard of Etra Prime, Doctor?
DOCTOR: The oldest planetoid in the universe, Lord President? Dreary little rock, of course. It wound up in the vicinity of the Archetryx system, didn't it?
VANSELL: For most of recorded time it has been of little interest to anyone except occasional planetary geologists, until a seam of minerals unique in the known universe was discovered deep in the substrata.
DOCTOR: How fascinating.
PRESIDENT: It became fascinating, Doctor, when it was found that the minerals responded in ways
PRESIDENT: contrary to the laws of physics. Archetryx opened Etra Prime to a host of interested parties in exchange for furthering their own scientific knowledge.
VANSELL: The people of Archetryx had limited time travel capabilities. We gave them some assistance.
DOCTOR: I see. Well, was it worth it?
PRESIDENT: Fifty powers had representatives on Etra Prime. There were some five hundred lifeforms engaged in top secret research unlocking the energies in these new materials, when (coughs) Forgive me.
VANSELL: Take these, Lord President.
PRESIDENT: Oh, my pills. Thank you. I should not be here now, Doctor. I serve an interim role until the fate of (coughs). Presidents have come and gone since I retired from office, but my advice is still sought from time to time. It really can be a nuisance, you know.
DOCTOR: I quite understand, Lord President, but er, the point?
VANSELL: Barely into her first term of office, the then President was on Etra Prime for an official visit when er
PRESIDENT: The planetoid vanished.
DOCTOR: Vanished?
VANSELL: It was taken out of time and space, along with all personnel. There have been sporadic sightings of it rumoured since, but er
DOCTOR: Did you follow them up?
VANSELL: To no avail.
PRESIDENT: A year after Etra Prime vanished, three hundred corpses were discovered here on Archetryx, riddled with time distortion.
VANSELL: You can imagine the outcry. There was almost war, but Archetryx denied all knowledge.
DOCTOR: I take it your new President was among those dead?
PRESIDENT: No, Doctor. Romanadvoratrelundar remains missing.
DOCTOR: Romana?
TRINKETT: Ah, there you are, Vorna.
VORNA: This is Evelyn, Monitor Trinkett. One of the President's
TRINKETT: I know. Ensac told me. Now, your registration details, Delegate Evelyn.
EVELYN: Oh, what a lovely bracelet you're wearing.
TRINKETT: It's a wrist communicator, Delegate Evelyn. We all wear them.
EVELYN: Oh. Oh yes. There's Vorna's. Silly me. Still, pretty and functional. That's good. That's really very. Er, shouldn't you switch off your alarm clock?
TRINKETT: Damn. That's a. No, that can't be right.
TRINKETT: Ensac, report to Control immediately. Ensac, confirm.
VORNA: What's the problem?
TRINKETT: Where is he? We're registering some kind of gravitational disturbance.
VORNA: Where?
TRINKETT: Our sector of space, only a few parsecs from here.
VORNA: Some kind of attack?
TRINKETT: No, it's too big to be a spaceship.
EVELYN: Would now be a good time to check your defences are working properly?
TRINKETT: Shields functioning normally, except the power levels. Well, Ensac's the expert. Ensac, this is Control. Respond please. I think, I think our phantom planet's back again. Repeat, I think Etra Prime's come back to haunt us.
TRINKETT: [OC]: Ensac, please respond. Ensac, please respond.
ENSAC: High Minister, please. If you're feeling better now, I must report to Monitor Trinkett.
MINISTER: No, Ensac, you must listen to me. Listen to me, Ensac.
ENSAC: What's that noise?
MINISTER: Don't resist it, Ensac.
ENSAC: No.
MINISTER: You will obey a higher power from now on, just as I do.
DOCTOR: But when did Etra Prime vanish, Lord President?
PRESIDENT: (sighs) Twenty years ago now.
DOCTOR: Oh. Oh, Romana. Talk about the frying pan and the fire. From E-Space into. Anyway.
VANSELL: Still no satisfactory explanation for the planetoid's disappearance has been found.
DOCTOR: And why not, Vansell? With all the dirtiest Time Lord tricks at your disposal, I'd have thought by now
VANSELL: Etra Prime has been taken out of Time altogether.
DOCTOR: Something far beyond Archetryx's capabilities.
VANSELL: The rulers of Archetryx have offered up their world to inspection and instigated this conference.
PRESIDENT: It is hoped that agreement can be reached on the limitation of Time manipulation among these emergent planetary powers.
DOCTOR: Oh, I thought as much. You're here to protect your own mystique, and to make sure no one's getting too big for their boots. But what about finding Etra Prime, eh? What about finding Romana?
VANSELL: This conference gives us the perfect opportunity to learn who here possesses the capability to remove a world from Time altogether, and thus a step closer to finding the guilty party.
DOCTOR: Oh, splendid. It's taken you twenty years to get that far, has it? And as you say yourself, your plan does rather depend on the guilty party being here at all.
PRESIDENT: At the very least, Doctor, we may find a clue.
DOCTOR: And in the meantime any insight into alternative Time technologies will do you very nicely.
PRESIDENT: Vansell may have his own agenda, but mine is to discover the truth. Who can have done this, Doctor? Who would risk the wrath of so many galactic powers?
DOCTOR: Who indeed. Wait. Of course. That chronic disturbance I mentioned. Vansell, what it if was Etra Prime making one of its fleeting reappearances?
VANSELL: The thought had occurred to me.
DOCTOR: Then we must find out for sure. Come on, man. Quickly!
VANSELL: We'd better join your friend in Central Control.
DALEK: Unit seven reporting.
DALEK: 2: You may approach the Black Dalek.
BLACK: Speak.
DALEK: Etra Prime now approaching Archetryx.
BLACK: Has the Archetryxan agent been prepared for our purpose?
DALEK: He obeys without question.
BLACK: The time grows near. Soon the Daleks will attain their greatest triumph.
TRINKETT: Ensac, about time. Where the hell have you been?
ENSAC: You are picking up some kind of signal, Monitor?
TRINKETT: I think it's Etra Prime.
ENSAC: Impossible, Monitor.
TRINKETT: Trinkett. How many more times? Drop the Monitor. Oh well, never mind. Look, I checked. It's in the same region as those rogue sightings that were logged.
ENSAC: Your readings are wrong, Trinkett.
TRINKETT: What?
ENSAC: The instrumentation is faulty.
TRINKETT: Well, the mass seems low.
ENSAC: I must power down the instrumentation panel.
TRINKETT: Ensac. But you've shut down the external scanners now too, and the shield controls.
ENSAC: I, I must check the instrumentation.
TRINKETT: Ensac, are you all right?
ENSAC: Yes, Trinkett.
TRINKETT: Look, just get it sorted, okay? Quick.
ENSAC: (sotto) I will do as I have been instructed.
EVELYN: No sign of him here. He obviously doesn't fancy the delegatesâ€™ buffet.
VORNA: All right, let's split up. We'll look less conspicuous.
EVELYN: Right. I'll take the west wing, shall I?
VORNA: We'll meet back in twenty minutes.
EVELYN: Is that space minutes or good old-fashioned Earth minutes?
VORNA: I'm sorry?
EVELYN: Oh, never mind. Twenty whatevers. See you then. Excuse me. Thank you, Yes, primitive Earth woman coming through. Oh, aren't you an interesting colour. Goodness.
TRINKETT: [OC]: Vorna. Vorna, Ensac's turned up. Get yourself back here.
VORNA: But I've just sent
TRINKETT: [OC]: Now, Vorna. I need you here. There's something not right.
TRINKETT: (sotto) Look, just move it, Vorna, okay?
TRINKETT: You're sure that's absolutely necessary, Ensac?
ENSAC: It is necessary.
TRINKETT: (sotto) That's all I need. (normal) May I help you, Delegate Vansell, and Delegate?
DOCTOR: I'm known as the Doctor, although I imagine I may be known by some slightly more colourful names around here, Mizz?
VANSELL: Doctor, this is Monitor Trinkett.
DOCTOR: Ah.
TRINKETT: Well, personnel restrictions do apply to Time Lords too. You've placed us in a difficult position, Delegate Doctor.
DOCTOR: For which I cannot apologise enough, so I shan't even start. Now, tell me, Monitor Trinkett, have you noticed anything untoward in this sector of space recently?
TRINKETT: Well
DOCTOR: Something planet sized?
TRINKETT: How could you?
VANSELL: Then Etra Prime has returned.
TRINKETT: No. It's impossible. I thought there was something out there, but the instruments are faulty.
VANSELL: Faulty?
TRINKETT: Must be. Anyway, the object's mass didn't correlate to our records of Etra Prime.
DOCTOR: So it's been thoroughly mined. Anything else?
TRINKETT: It was moving too fast to be a planet.
VANSELL: What do you mean, moving?
TRINKETT: Ridiculous, isn't it. It was heading this way.
DOCTOR: Piloted.
TRINKETT: So the detectors must be faulty, right?
DOCTOR: And your young friend there would be fixing them?
TRINKETT: Ensac's the expert.
ENSAC: I must do as I have been instructed.
DOCTOR: Must you, indeed.
VANSELL: So effectively you're saying we're blind here.
TRINKETT: Better than trusting to faulty detectors.
DOCTOR: I wonder what they'd be showing you now?
EVELYN: Well, he's not in Engineering.
EVELYN: Oops. Goodness.
EVELYN: Who's this, then?
MINISTER: I obey.
EVELYN: (sotto) Who do you obey, I wonder, Mister Highly Suspicious Minister?
COMPUTER: Berthing bay access requires authorisation code. (beeps) Thank you, High Minister. Code accepted.
EVELYN: (sotto) And what can you be after in there?
VORNA: Monitor Trinkett, I came as soon as I could.
TRINKETT: All right, Vorna, not in front of the delegates. I'm pretending everything's fine.
VORNA: You mean it isn't?
TRINKETT: I don't know, but if the Time Lords get wind of any problems
DOCTOR: Perhaps I could give you a hand, Ensac? I'm quite proficient at this sort of thing.
ENSAC: I must complete the repairs.
DOCTOR: Oh, come on now, I can help.
ENSAC: Leave me alone! (thump)
DOCTOR: Oh, steady!
TRINKETT: Ensac, get off him! What are you doing?
VANSELL: That's enough, Ensac.
TRINKETT: Vorna, restrain him!
DOCTOR: Oh. For such a slight girl, Vorna, you pack quite a wallop.
VORNA: Consider Ensac restrained, Monitor.
VANSELL: That probe. He was going to put a hole in your head.
DOCTOR: I had noticed.
TRINKETT: Delegates, I can't apologise
DOCTOR: Don't. I think it's more important to see what he was up to.
VORNA: He's coming round.
TRINKETT: Ensac?
ENSAC: I must carry out my instructions.
VANSELL: Whose instructions? Well?
DALEK: 2: Units are nearing target undetected.
DALEK: Our agent is in position in the berthing bay.
DALEK: 2: Archetryx in range in twenty rels.
DALEK: Victory for the Daleks is assured.
EVELYN: Where's he gone now? Inconsiderate devil. How does he expect me to see what he's up to in the dark?
MINISTER: The device is in position, master.
EVELYN: Device? That sounds nasty, and it looks. Oh, my God!
DOCTOR: Ensac's wrecked the scanners and altered the shield settings in some way.
VORNA: What do you mean?
DOCTOR: Well, they're jammed on.
TRINKETT: I don't understand. Ensac, were you trying to keep something out?
DOCTOR: Or all of us in?
ENSAC: Must carry out my instructions.
DOCTOR: Could he perhaps be moved somewhere soundproofed? I need to think. If I can get the external detectors functioning.
VANSELL: We need to know who he's working for.
VORNA: He's not working for anyone. This is an internal security matter, Delegate Vansell.
DOCTOR: Ah! There we are. (beeps) Oh no.
VANSELL: What is it?
DOCTOR: Right outside. The detectors are picking up lifesigns.
VORNA: What? How many?
DOCTOR: Nearly thirty. If I can just get visual back online.
ENSAC: No. No.
EVELYN: I can't just hide back here. Excuse me, Minister. What are you doing here? What is that thing?
MINISTER: I obey, master.
EVELYN: It's a bomb, isn't it? You let off that thing, you'll bring the walls down on us.
MINISTER: Detonation imminent.
EVELYN: Get away from there! Come on!
DALEK: Secure the berthing bay. Crush resistance. Proceed to Engineering section. Exterminate all personnel. Proceed! Proceed!
VORNA: What was that?
DALEK: [OC]: Exterminate. Exterminate.
DOCTOR: Look. Look at the screens.
TRINKETT: What are those things?
DOCTOR: Daleks. The most ruthless forms of life in the universe. Will I never be rid of them?
ENSAC: Daleks.
TRINKETT: Ensac? He's dead.
DOCTOR: The Daleks had no further use for him.
VANSELL: Then the Daleks must possess Etra Prime, and they're steering it towards us.
EVELYN: [OC]: Please, anyone.
DOCTOR: Evelyn?
TRINKETT: That's the general address system. She must be in
EVELYN: [OC]: I'm in the berthing bay. The High Minister is dead.
TRINKETT: The High Minister? Oh, this is crazy.
EVELYN: [OC]: He set of some kind of bomb, and now metal creatures are pouring in from outside. I'm trapped here by debris. Please someone be hearing this.
DOCTOR: We've got to get her out of there.
TRINKETT: This is so screwed up. Vorna, get going. Guards! (under dialogue) All guards, to the berthing bay immediately. Immediately. This is not a drill.
VORNA: Don't worry, Doctor. I'll make sure she's safe.
DOCTOR: I'm going with you, Vorna.
VANSELL: You can't go, Doctor.
DOCTOR: I'd advise you, Vansell, to let go of me immediately.
TRINKETT: Repeat, this is not a drill.
VANSELL: If Etra Prime is on its way here, we must know what we're up against. That's not my area of expertise.
DOCTOR: I can't just leave Evelyn.
VANSELL: I'll send our own Chancellery Guards down there. We'll get her out.
DOCTOR: As long as / get us out of this mess.
VANSELL: You're wasting time, Doctor.
VANSELL: Guards. All guards, full alert get down to the berthing bay now. Full combat status.
DALEK: Warning, humanoid counter-offensive. We are under attack.
EVELYN: Here comes the cavalry. Over here! Come on, shift, can't you? I'm stuck over here. Please.
DALEK: Exterminate.
EVELYN: Oh God, I wasn't talking to you.
EVELYN: Thank you. Commander Vorna. What on Earth are these things?
VORNA: Daleks.
EVELYN: I take it they're not on the guest list.
VORNA: That came from Engineering.
VANSELL: Vorna, your people must fall back.
VORNA: But surely we have to hold them here?
VANSELL: In case it escaped your notice, the Daleks just wiped out Engineering. They've got further than we. Look out!
DALEK: Exterminate.
EVELYN: Can your lot hold them?
VORNA: I don't know. I don't know!
TRINKETT: Anything coming through from Etra Prime?
DOCTOR: Not yet. I'm broadcasting a distress signal on all frequencies, but Daleks don't make for the most sympathetic audience. Oh, I see. It seems the Daleks have shut down our external communications links.
TRINKETT: We're completely cut off?
DOCTOR: I'm afraid so.
VANSELL: [OC]: This is Vansell.
DOCTOR: Evelyn?
VANSELL: [OC]: She's safe. Vorna has her.
DOCTOR: Oh, good work. Good work, Vorna.
VORNA: [OC]: Trinkett, they've destroyed the Engineering complex. All personnel dead. Now they seem to be regrouping here. More reinforcements arriving now. Quite a mixture.
DOCTOR: Look after Evelyn for me.
VORNA: [OC]: I think she thinks she's looking after me. Out.
TRINKETT: All my engineers.
DOCTOR: Oh, I'm sorry.
TRINKETT: I just can't believe that the High Minister could sabotage what we've been planning so long.
DOCTOR: The Daleks could have many agents in your government.
TRINKETT: At least it explains why he was personally inspecting the shields yesterday.
DOCTOR: Allowing the Task Force safe passage, yes. But why enter via the berthing bay, I wonder? And why regroup there now instead of attacking?
TRINKETT: Like fixing the shields and fixing the engineers. It must be to stop us leaving.
DOCTOR: But then the Daleks are trapped here too. The shields are temporal in nature, I take it?
TRINKETT: Right. Everything inside the barrier exists a good minute in the future. It's all powered by the gravity wells.
DOCTOR: Of course, the key to your time travel.
TRINKETT: Even they've been playing up.
DOCTOR: Really? What, that disturbance earlier?
TRINKETT: We can't understand why, but the power surges have always been within safety tolerance, just about, so no one's been bothered.
DOCTOR: Hmm. Well, Ensac's done too good a job of wrecking the shield controls here. With Engineering out. I have to see the gravity wells. Perhaps we can manipulate the shields from there.
TRINKETT: You expect me to open the wells to, to an outsider?
DOCTOR: We're all outsiders to the Daleks, and we'll all surely die together unless you give me access.
TRINKETT: All right. Come on.
VANSELL: The Daleks could take us easily. Why are they staying put with just a few sentries to stop us getting too near?
VORNA: It's like they're searching for something.
EVELYN: Something like that big grey box, by the look of it.
VANSELL: Of course. The Monan Host ship, the most powerful vessel here. We have to stop them.
EVELYN: You want them to stay?
VORNA: If the shields are jammed on, how can they?
VANSELL: That's the one ship here that might bypass them. The Monan craft is still at a fairly embryonic stage, but our observations suggest their power supply's phenomenal. Like nothing we possess.
EVELYN: Not that that had anything to do with your attending the conference. Planning a little snooping were we?
VORNA: Wait. What are they
VANSELL: They can't all fit inside. Not dimensionally transcendental, then. Did you see how many got in?
VORNA: Eight, maybe?
EVELYN: Makes you feel better, does it, Vansell? Happy camper now?
VANSELL: They're doing it. They're breaking free.
VORNA: That technology in the Dalek's hands.
VANSELL: It should have been Gallifrey's.
EVELYN: If it's any consolation, there's still about twenty Daleks who missed the bus.
VORNA: And here they come.
BLACK: Black Dalek to Monan time vessel. Report status.
DALEK: [OC]: Power systems breached. Initial tests suggest power source ninety one percent probability to penetrate shields.
BLACK: As predicted.
DALEK: [OC]: Commencing dematerialisation.
BLACK: Hurry. The temporal drive is needed here on Etra Prime.
TRINKETT: Here, you'll need this survival suit.
DOCTOR: Hmm. Expecting inclement weather?
TRINKETT: It's pitch black in the gravity wells. Dangerous. They're vast, full of energies we barely understand.
DOCTOR: And something else. While you were fetching the suits I diverted some of these scanner links to monitor the interior of the wells.
TRINKETT: I didn't know they could do that.
DOCTOR: They can't. I had to ask your computer very nicely. We need some idea of the basic layout if we're to tamper a little.
TRINKETT: What did you find?
DOCTOR: That there's a high level of impurity registering.
TRINKETT: Does that matter? We can still manipulate the gravity fields without out what it is, can't we?
DOCTOR: Don't like mysteries. One lot of bodies was dumped on the surface of Archetryx.
TRINKETT: You think
DOCTOR: I don't want to, but with the Daleks here and Etra Prime moving closer by the second, this may be my last chance to learn what's happened to Romana.
TRINKETT: Romana?
DOCTOR: My, my friend.
DALEK: Monan vessel to Black Dalek on Etra Prime.
BLACK: [OC]: Report.
DALEK: Shields still holding.
BLACK: [OC]: Increase drive to maximum power.
DALEK: Maximum power.
DALEK: Shields giving way.
BLACK: [OC]: You will breach the barriers. Nothing can resist the Daleks!
EVELYN: Uh oh. The Daleks are getting restless.
VORNA: They're fanning out. Is it an attack?
VANSELL: They're not even watching us. Out of here, quickly! Everyone out. Those Daleks approaching, they're going to self-destruct!
EVELYN: What?
EVELYN: Tell me, are you Time Lords right about everything?
VORNA: Oh, what a mess. We'll never shift that lot.
VANSELL: The Daleks have made sure we're staying here. I must tell the President.
VORNA: And the other delegates. Come on.
EVELYN: I'm going to try and find the Doctor.
DOCTOR: So, these are your gravity wells.
TRINKETT: It's zero gravity once beyond the safety zone. Use your boot clamps.
DOCTOR: Ah, yes.
TRINKETT: There should be an inspection ladder down here.
DOCTOR: Down into the darkness. I'm glad the torch is working. Ah, a sign. No unqualified personnel beyond this point. Splendid. Here we go then.
TRINKETT: Doctor.
DOCTOR: Yes?
TRINKETT: I think I heard something.
DOCTOR: Imagination, I hope.
TRINKETT: No, listen.
TRINKETT: Oh, what was that? Urgh!
DOCTOR: Trinkett, I
TRINKETT: Now it's on my back!
DOCTOR: What is?
TRINKETT: Well, you've got the torch. Urgh, it's trying to burrow into my suit.
DOCTOR: Let me see. No, back up the ladder, Trinkett, quickly.
TRINKETT: What are they?
DOCTOR: Dalek mutants. The creatures inside the travel machines, operating independently in the zero gravity.
TRINKETT: Why? How?
DOCTOR: So they can attack more urgh! effectively.
TRINKETT: The air's thick with them.
DOCTOR: We have to get out of here, Trinkett. Move! Up the ladder, quickly!
TRINKETT: I, I can't they're all over me! Doctor!

elements.text: [Part Two]
Footsteps. Not today, then. Not today.
Door opens and closes. A person with what sounds like a slightly speeded up voice speaks.
Unit one one seven? You are unit one one seven?
It's not over yet, then.
I, is

Even after twenty years, I still fear them coming for me. They leave me here in the cell for days at a time, no distractions, no exercise, no food, and you never hear them coming, and it's dark, so you never see them. They roll along that metal floor, closer and closer, soundlessly, nearer, nearer. Stop outside the door.
Please I

That voice, the orders, the pushing you down the corridor for the special service, and you see them crowding around you, all sharp lines and angles and sticks, watching you do whatever it is they can't or choose not to do for themselves.
I am not one of the slave elite.

They may look like the robots, but you know what, what you've become. And just as we wouldn't thank a robot when the work is done, they send you away again in silence. Silently up the corridor, the black plastic poking you in the back, and you look down and you remember when your body was full and young and fit and not emaciated, atrophying in some stinking hole in the rock. And you come back, step after step, and the numbers are always the same, just as the days and the nights are always the same. And all that's changing is a little bit of you is dying, day after day after
You're unit one one seven
I am not unit one one seven! I am Romanadvoratrelundar. I have no choice but to let the Daleks dehumanise me, but I will not tolerate the same treatment from you. Who are you?
Unit sixty three.
Your name, you idiot. You have a name, don't you? Or have the Daleks taken that from you with everything else.
My name is Vrint. I am Vrint of the Monan Host.
(sighs) That's better. Why have you come for me, Vrint?
The Daleks want you. Want us. I am not a member of the elite. I've been mining the rock with the others all this time.
So what are you doing here with me, now?
The Daleks are too busy to fetch you themselves. Before they took us all, I was an engineer. Now the Daleks possess a Monan time vessel.
They've brought it here?
The technology is new. The Daleks say you must help me carry out my orders.
(sotto) A time machine. Oh, to travel again. To open a door and not know what lay the other side. (normal) What are your orders?
The Daleks will be waiting. Perhaps, perhaps we can talk to each other as we go, Romanadavo
Call me Romana. Perhaps we can, Vrint. Perhaps we can.
I can't hold on.
Don't give up. You're nearly there.
It's got my leg. A mutant's got my leg.
No, no, that's me. I've got hold of your ankle and I'm going to push you up, all right? Get ready to reach out for the safety bar. Here we go!
Oh, made it.
Here they are. Go on, keep moving. Get to the doors.
What about you?
Just get out of there. Too many. I can't
Doctor!
Deep rumble.
What?
Dalek mutants slow down.
It's all right. Oh, they're weakening.
That vibration. Someone's tampered with the power couplings.
Increasing the gravity field. Probably saved our lives.
Not for long. If the power supply isn't properly regulated at all times
Come on!
Alien panicking.
Delegates, please. We must remain calm. We must apply ourselves to our predicament.
Door opens and closes.
Vansell, thank goodness.
Lord President, the Daleks have sealed off the berthing bay. We're trapped!
What can the Daleks want?
The Monan Host ship for a start. They've hi-jacked it.
Our ship, stolen by Daleks? Explain yourself.
I fear the Daleks will spare you the effort. Look! There, on the viewscreen.
No, it can't be!
[OC]: Attention all lifeforms on Archetryx. This is the Black Dalek. Resistance is useless. You are now prisoners of the Daleks.
Door opens and closes.
That's the Monan time machine?
Yes.
Right in the Dalek throne room. It's obviously highly important to them. Now perhaps we might learn why they've been mining this rock hollow, what those Dalek scientists are up to on Archetryx.
Units one one seven and sixty three will disengage the main drive. You will follow Dalek instructions.

(sotto) Armed escort. No chance of escape. (normal) Let me see this plan. (rustle of thick paper) What is this? You want us to construct some kind of temporal centrifuge? What for? Some chemical compound you've been synthesising? Is that what your scientists have been up to on Etra Prime?
2: You will obey or you will be exterminated!
(sotto) Same old choice for twenty years. (normal) Vrint, let's begin.
Why is that Dalek Black?
It's their leader.
Very well, Dalek. You're here to gloat. Do so and be gone.
[OC]: Delegates, we are launching attacks on the most strategic of your homeworlds. With governments mourning their dead leaders, retaliation will be less effective.
Nonsense. We're still very much alive, and your Daleks have entombed themselves in the berthing bay.
[OC]: We are taking the secrets of your ships. We shall use this information against you.
Damn them. There's no way to get back at them.
You won't get the chance, Dalek. Do you seriously think that the rulers of Archetryx will stand by and let your atrocities go unpunished? Even now they must be working to free us.
[OC]: Dalek duplicates replaced the rulers of Archetryx many years ago. They will not act against the Daleks.
You're, you're trying to trick us.
[OC]: We are responsible for the disappearance of Etra Prime, and we are responsible for the massacre of its people.
Consternation in the background.
What of our President? What of Romanadvoratrelundar?
[OC]: Your President heads our slave elite.
You hear that, Vansell? She's alive!
[OC]: We have manipulated you all.
Using us, through the most High Minister, through our own fear of reprisals. All this time they were hiding in the shadows.
We've all been the Dalek's fools.
[OC]: Now you will be exterminated. Etra Prime is set on a collision course with Archetryx. The time of the Daleks has come.
Bulkhead door opens and closes. Heavy footsteps. Alarm beeping.
Evelyn! So it was you tampering.
Oh, Doctor, thank heavens. Hey, what's that slime all over you?

Oh, we had a run-in with some Dalek mutants, the very essence of putrescence. I suppose that in zero gravity their casings would only be a hindrance. Now, do you remember which controls you pressed? Think, Evelyn. It's important.
Well, I pressed every damn thing I could find, to be honest. I was trying to get you out.
Rumble.
Oh, help. What have I done?
You've saved our lives. Now, let me have a look at these displays.
How did you even find us, Evelyn?
I found the Doctor's note in Central Control. Then I spent half an hour translating it.
Hmm?
Imbalance ratio ninety one and rising. Much higher and it'll blow the wells wide open and kill all of us.
What can we do? The Daleks will destroy us.
We have to get back to our time ships and hope the Doctor can bring down the shields. At least there'll be fewer Daleks in the bay now.
We can't get through that wreckage, not with Engineering all dead.
Everyone will have to help. It's the only way.
And even if we can escape, the Lady Romanadvoratrelundar must still be trapped.
These engines are impressive.
How sad we must destroy them for the Daleks.
[OC]: Attention, attention. This is the Black Dalek. Transmat operators to positions. Prepare inertia chamber. Initiate stage one evacuation of Etra Prime.
They're ready to move out. But what will they be transmatting up from Archetryx?
The Dalek creatures working there?

Or whatever they've been synthesising on Archetryx. If they're using an inertia chamber, it must be so volatile they daren't risk handling it. Ah. And that's why the Daleks need this centrifuge. To produce an end result faster.
Before we evacuate?
Before they evacuate.
Ah.
Come on. Help me with this. Perhaps we'll learn more when we present it to the Black Dalek.
Door opens.
Report.
Archetryx units report massive disturbance in gravity wells. Fatalities estimated forty five percent.
The Dalek scientists will all die in the collision. Is the element damaged?
No. It is protected and ready for dispatch.
All must be prepared for the harvesting. Proceed.
Lots of beeps and burbles.
Right. I think Evelyn has created some kind of feedback loop.
That is, after all, my forte.
As tidying up after others is mine. Hold on.
Power builds with a bang.
Steady.
If I can set up a counter vibration to stop the harmonic imbalance.
More bangs and crashes, then beeps and power diminish.
You did it!
Imbalance ratio falling.
So are the shields down now? Can we get away?
No, But we can manipulate the fields from out here and er. Why are you looking at me like that, Doctor?
The exterior console's now exclusively dedicated to countering the feedback loop.
You mean?
The only way of shutting down those shields is to go back inside and do it manually.
Oh dear.
I'm not sure I can go through that again.
I wouldn't dream of making you. I'll go alone.
But
No arguments, please. There isn't time. But, er, if you have another suit I could wear?
Come on, back to Main Control.
Door opens.
(sotto) Vrint, the Black Dalek.
(sotto) What is that crystal?
(sotto) I don't know. but it doesn't suit him.
Slaves will approach.
We've constructed the temporal centrifuge as requested.
Put down the device.
2: Inertia chamber prepared.
Once the element is harvested and the crystal retrieved
Another crystal?
You will remain to pilot the planetoid into Archetryx.
2: I obey.
Into Archetryx? You're destroying Etra Prime and Archetryx so that no clues remain as to this element of yours?
Be silent!
These crystals
Be silent! You will prepare the temporal centrifuge or
All right! I understand.
Archetryx approaching transmat range. Fifty, forty nine
Prepare to harvest the element.
Door opens and closes.
I'll fetch the suit.
Think I'll check my scanner repairs are (beep)
Oh my!
Etra Prime.
It's huge.
No. Not a pretty planetoid, is it?
The Daleks aim to crash it right into us.
Vansell. What are you doing here?
To see if you've shut down the shields.
I'm working on it. What's been happening?

The Daleks have been gloating at our expense, but at least it's galvanised the delegates into action. I've organised them into teams, helping the guards clear the debris for a coordinated assault on the berthing bay. Even the Virgoans are joining in.
Oh dear.
I might go down to the berthing bay myself.
I'd rather you stayed here, where, where it's
Where it's safe. Doctor, you're risking your neck to get those shields down. Perhaps I can help make a way through to the berthing bay, to the Tardis. Then I'll feel safe.
Be careful, Evelyn. Vansell, let's pool our experiences.
Footsteps, door opens and closes.
Telepathically?
Mmm hmm.
Very well. Contact.
Contact.
Door opens.
That's right, delegate. Help me with this. We'll be through to the bay if we can just ah!
Stones fall.
Well done.
I can see light. We are through
Dalek weapons fire. Screams.
Get down! Take cover!)
Exterminate! Exterminate!
Energy weapons fire. Dalek gurgle. Boom! Debris falls.
Dead.
The Daleks? I take it we haven't got them on the run, then.
Exchange of weapons fire.

Oh, Evelyn, we were never prepared for anything like this. We put so much faith in our brilliant shields. Now, even if we fight our way into the bay and take every Dalek waiting for us, their threat is still hanging over us.
Hanging over.
I'm sorry?
Vorna, surely there's some other way of getting into the berthing bay? An inspection hatch, or something. Even, God help us, a ventilation shaft.
I'd have thought you more than anyone would have noticed the ceiling coming down.
There might be something. Or do you want to sit here playing dodge the Dalek till the sky really does fall in?
Oh, all right. Let's take a look.
Trust Time Lords to be the most clinical gossips around.
So Romana's still alive.
For now.
Right then. Put on this lovely new suit, and back into the gravity wells. To the bottom, this time.
The mutants will kill you.

I'm hoping they'll still be shaken up by that vibration. And this time I'll leave the torch switched off. In the darkness, they may not spot me in time. Now, I'll need you, Trinkett, to guide me from here. Vansell, you get back to the bay. Look after Evelyn and the others.
Yes, Doctor.
Receiving transmission from Archetryx. (Daleks continue quietly behind dialogue.)

Vrint, did you see the way the crystal glowed? That must be it. The crystal channels Dalek mental energy in some way. They couldn't transmit messages from Archetryx by conventional means without risking discovery.
The Apocalypse Element is prepared.
Three, two
Apocalypse Element? I don't like the sound of that.
Beeping.
Archetryx is in range.
Activate transmat now.
Whirr! Beeps.
Transfer of element stable.
Prepare to operate the temporal centrifuge.
All right. (sotto) Be ready, Vrint. We'll only get one chance at this.
Uneven light thuds.
I wasn't designed for a space so small.
You were right though, Evelyn. This must be one of the fuelling channels. If we can get down into the bay, perhaps start a distraction to draw the Daleks from the entrance.
We could give the others a fighting chance, however small.
Door opens and closes.
Right, I'm in. Just feeling for the inspection ladder.
[OC]: Keep going down, Doctor. You should there's a service walkway stretching out around the rim.
Right.
[OC]: That'll lead to the gravitron focus, though how you're going to put it out of action in the dark
My laser probe has an illuminated tip.
[OC]: Show off.
Mmm, aren't I? Better not talk. I can sense them, here in the darkness. Don't want to draw attention to myself.
[OC]: Understood. Be careful, Doctor. Out.
Centrifuge stops.
The process is complete. Place inertia chamber within the centrifuge.
No, no, wait a moment. I, I have to check that the er radiation from the transmat console won't affect the element upon release.
There is no risk of irradiation. Move away from the transmat.
I have to be sure.
Exterminate her.
Block the chamber, Vrint.
Exterminate.
No! Do not fire at the inertia chamber! Circle around.
That crystal really doesn't suit you, Dalek.
What?
Got it!
Retrieve the crystal!
Quickly, get in. I've reversed the settings on the transmat. Cross your fingers. Here we go.
Exterminate.
Dalek weapons fire.
All right, Vorna. Standing by. Out.
There is a way through from above?
Vorna and Evelyn believe so.
We must organise our remaining forces into strategic positions. This may be the final battle.
All right, Trinkett, I've found the walkway. Moving along it now.
Dalek mutants squeak as they fly around.
Not again.
[OC]: Doctor?

They're after me, launching themselves in my direction. I must reach the controls. Urgh. Oh, filthy thing. Trinkett, I've found the access panel. Hold on, there's a light below me. Transmat? (loud) Look out down there!
[OC]: What's happening?
I'm not sure. I think someone's in here with me. Some of the Daleks are leaving me to attack whoever it is. Now, I'm just removing the access plate.
Get off me!
Romana?
[OC]: Doctor, if the Daleks already know you're there, switch on the lights.
How can I?
[OC]: Master override. It should be to your
Quickly, Trinkett.
[OC]: It should be to your left.
Right.
Squelch.
Oh! Nothing to my left but a mutant. It's got my hand. Oh, get off. Oh. Ah.
Power hums.
Oh, the lights are on. Blinding. The mutants don't like it.
[OC]: They're leaving you alone?
I think so. Come on, eyes. It's too bright. Still, all the master craftsmen can do a job like this with their eyes closed.
Beeps and burbles. Power drops.
[OC]: You've done it! The wells are draining.
The Doctor sighs. Sounds of things squelching on impact below.
Normal gravity's back. The Daleks have come down to earth, or rather, lead plating, with a bump. Not pretty.
[OC]: The shields are losing cohesion. They're failing.
All right, Trinkett, lend your strength to the war effort. I'll follow on. And I do believe I'll be bringing guests.
The female has taken the focussing crystal.
Element and centrifuge undamaged. Transmat bay destroyed by Dalek fire.
Then the second crystal is out of reach also. The female has escaped to Archetryx. The Dalek task force there must retrieve the crystal.
Romana!
Doctor! I don't believe it.
Don't you know how dangerous it is to be in here without a protective suit?
It's so good to. But you're wearing the wrong body.
No, I'm wearing the right body. Just not necessarily in the right order. Who might you be?
This is Vrint, one of the Monan Host.
Etra Prime is on a collision course with Archetryx.
Yes, that hadn't escaped our, our
Attention?
Look at all this equipment. Alchemist's dream.
They've been synthesising some kind of raw material.
Taking advantage of the unique conditions here.
Look. Look, these creatures are all wearing little crystals, like the big one you stole.
Like the one right behind you.
Let me see. Hmm, what are you for, I wonder?
I've got plenty of theories I could run past you.
Run being the operative word. There's not a moment to lose.
A moment, Doctor? I've been a prisoner for twenty years.
I know. And if I know you, you must be desperate for a good race against time.
After you, then? Age before beauty?
Hmm. Welcome back, Romana.
Effort.
Evelyn, just ahead there. See that? It's what's left of one of the fuel channels. Must have broken open in the blast.
Oh, it's slick with (squelch) Oh yuck. What kind of petrol do you use here?
We can slip down it, right behind the Daleks. (beep) Vansell? Get ready. We're going in.
Running.
Keep up, you two.
I wish the others had escaped.
Others?
They would have died anyway, Vrint. There was nothing we could do.
Stop running.
Not even mourn them for a moment?
Like you said, Doctor, there's not a moment to lose.
Romana!
Walking.
Now, these Dalek crystals. I think they modulate Dalek thought patterns, maybe even enhance them.
For communication?
A kind of telepathic decoder, perhaps? But I can't help thinking there's more to it than that.
Ah. Ah, our proud legion.
Doctor.
Hello, Trinkett. You spread the good news, I trust?
Look there, Vrint. A friend for you.
Comrade. My comrade! (recedes) I never dreamed I would see another like
President Romanadvoratrelundar.
Oh, my old Lord President. Please, won't you call me Romana?
Romana.
So I've not been deposed, then?
Mere weeks into your presidency? I fought for you, my dear.
I'm glad you've arrived safely.
Oh. Coordinator Vansell. It's you. Well, what is it?
Vorna and Evelyn are through, Doctor.
They're unharmed?
They're our decoys. Everyone be ready. The attack begins
Dalek weapons fire.
Now!
Lots of energy weapons fire on both sides.
Aim for the eye piece. It's a weak point.
Boom. A Dalek screams and gurgles.
Under attack!
The way is clear. Come on, into the bay.
Exterminate!
Evelyn, look out!
Weapons fire, boom, gurgle.
Goodness, that was close.
We did it, Evelyn.
All delegates head for your own time vessels.
Romana! With me, my dear.
[OC]: Capture Gallifreyan female. Retrieve crystal. Retrieve the crystal!
Romana, they're after you!
Perhaps we can lead them away.
Romana, come back!
No time, Lord President. Into our Tardis. Come on. Goodbye, Doctor.
Tardis dematerialises.
Oh, don't mention it. Trinkett, Evelyn, Vorna, we'll lead the Daleks away. You make sure the delegates get back to their ships.
Halt. Surrender the crystal.
Evelyn, take this.
The Tardis key? But the Daleks are blocking the way.
Not for long. Wait for us there. Come on, Romana.
Just like the old days. Nothing changes.
As soon as they saw the Doctor and that woman, they just ignored us.
Feeling slighted?
Go on, get these delegates safely away from here. We need a bit of good PR after today.
We have no ship!
Oh, you're a Monan, aren't you? You can hitch a ride with the Andromedans. That goes for you too, Vorna. Get on with it!
And you?
I'm going to watch out for the Doctor. Reckon we owe him that much.
I'll come with you.
Be careful, both of you.
Push off, Vorna.
Come on then, delegate.
I'm not a delegate or a number.
Goodbye, Vorna.
Only five minutes to impact!
Oh, goodness me. We'd better dash!
Running, breathless.
(distant) Surrender the crystal. Surrender the crystal.
It must mean more to them than just a means of communication.
You're out of shape.
And we're out of options.
You noticed the crystals on their casings.
Helping focus the mental commands?
Yes, very possibly. Quick, down here.
I
Surrender the crystal!
Oh, all right. (stops running) You can have it. But let my friend here go first.
She must be exterminated.
Let her go, or I'll smash your crystal against this wall. Go on, Romana, to the end of the corridor.
Doctor, another one.
2: Do not move.
Your friend just said I could.
Afraid so. Don't kick him out of the union or anything, will you. I did threaten to destroy your precious crystal. What you might call a Mexican stand-off. Ever exterminated any Mexicans?
Surrender the crystal.
I warn you, Dalek.
(distant) Down, Doctor!
Weapons fire. Explosions.
Trinkett. Impeccably timed. Everybody, run!
3: Halt! Halt! Exterminate!
I demand a meeting of the High Council immediately!
Gallifrey sleeps, Lord President. It is the middle of the night.
Ah, Guard Commander Reldath. At last.
Lord President, we welcome your safe
We must summon aid to Archetryx, Reldath. The rightful President is trapped there.
There's no time, Lord President. Collision is imminent. Monitor the situation, Reldath.
We must know what's happened to Romana, and the Doctor.
It will be done. Forgive me, but I have urgent news myself. In your absence, a deposition from the Monan Host world has encroached on Gallifreyan space seeking sanctuary.
What? On what grounds?
Observation posts confirm their world has been attacked by the Daleks.
Just as they said they would.
They insist they must speak with you.
Insist?
They're desperate.
No time for this. I'm so very tired. We can brook no aliens on Gallifrey. We cannot be seen to interfere.
The High Council has advised them there is little that can be done, but they keep signalling.
Put them on the conference screen.
Now? You cannot be suggesting
At least let's listen to them. The situation may afford certain er opportunities?
Running.
The Tardis. This way. Come on!
Do not move.
Oh, if you want your precious crystal so badly, catch!
Good gracious.
Crystal retrieved.
Now I've seen everything. A Dalek silly mid-off
We must report to the Black Dalek immediately. All units evacuate.
You've given the crystal back to the Daleks?
Oh, don't worry, We have a spare.
Rumble.
Etra Prime. It's hitting. We're too late!
It's never too late. Evelyn, into the Tardis. Now!
Tardis door opens. Explosions, the Tardis dematerialises.
[OC]: You are our only hope, Time Lords. If the Daleks are not the galaxy will stand together against
We understand your position. And as fellow survivors of the Daleks terrorism, we sympathise.
[OC]: Our world has been ravaged, our population decimated. All we request is a sanctuary for our Supreme Executive, that they may formulate a plan of campaign. We, we beg this of you.
We shall consider your plea, Nahal.
[OC]: We are grateful, Lord President.
Switch them off. (beep) I sympathise with Nahal's predicament, but Gallifrey cannot be seen to interfere. Not in matters of war.
Ordinarily I would agree, Lord President, but consider the Monan time ship. Look at it.
A graceless box.
One of the most powerful craft ever devised, and it's a different design from the one we saw. Do you see?
It seems even smaller.
Sleeker. Doubtless an improvement on the model they brought to Archetryx. They were
obviously hoping to keep this vessel secret.
You're obsessed, Vansell. Gallifrey does not need alien secrets.
There is much we could learn from the Monans. With their designs known to us, we could build the Tardises of the future. And once we've offered them non-committal sanctuary, we can set our terms.
I don't like it, Vansell. The Monans come to us in good faith.
Door opens.
Forgive me, Lord President. Our observation posts report Etra Prime has collided with Archetryx.
And Romana? The Doctor?
Two craft were detected in the Vortex nearby, one of them a Type 40 time capsule. It's coming this way.
Then they survived.
There's more. A Dalek fleet is approaching Gallifrey, my Lord.
A Dalek fleet?
They wouldn't dare. Surely they (pause) wouldn't dare.
Too much to consider. Everything's happening so fast. Perhaps they intend to wipe out the remaining Monans.
Very possibly. In which case this could be our last chance to study their

Silence, Vansell! Very well. Admit the Monan deposition. Just their flagship, though, Reldath. That ship only. I will not have Gallifrey overrun with aliens. (sigh) I suppose we should greet them upon arrival. Thank Rassilon that Romana is returning to us. She will know what to do for the best.
Well, by the skin of our teeth.
My world. Destroyed.
I'm sorry, Trinkett.
It's so strange to be back here. I'd forgotten the Tardis was so quaint.
(harrumphs) Oh, don't worry. We'll soon have you back shuffling papers on Gallifrey. Wait a minute.
Trouble?
Picking up a transmission. I'll put it through.
[OC]: The Daleks are moving in for the kill. Our fleet cannot hold them.
Daleks. They never stop. Never.
[OC]: Delegate Nahal, the Lord President will receive your flagship only. Repeat, your flagship only on these coordinates. Transduction barriers lowering on my mark.
[OC]: We thank you, Gallifrey. Engaging materialisation mode now.
Doctor, listen. That's Nahal, the Monan ambassador.
And Vrint, presumably.
Something's not right.
What do you mean?
The President's offering them asylum, letting them through.
He's letting something through.
Time ship lands.
