BLACK: [OC]: You will surrender.
DOCTOR: If we do, we betray the entire universe to the Daleks.
BLACK: [OC]: You will surrender!
DOCTOR: Never.
BLACK: [OC]: Then you must be shown the power of the Daleks.
ROMANA: No! Doctor!
DOCTOR: What is it?
ROMANA: The crystal! The Black Dalek's going to ignite the element.
DOCTOR: No! You can't!
BLACK: [OC]: The Dalek's destiny it to conquer or destroy.
DOCTOR: Romana, it's a mental charge the Dalek's using. Can you stop it, divert it, weaken it?
ROMANA: Oh! Oh! I, I'm trying.
BLACK: [OC]: The female's mind is too weak.
DOCTOR: Let me help.
ROMANA: No! It's too late! It's too late! (screams)
PRESIDENT: Romana! She's unconscious. Some kind of psychic shock.
DOCTOR: (furious) Dalek, what have you done!
BLACK: [OC]: Observe the screen.
DOCTOR: At the centre of Seriphia, fire. The destruction, it's begun.
BLACK: [OC]: Unless the Time Lords act to contain the reaction, galaxy one seven A five three will be totally destroyed.
DOCTOR: And from there it will soread. Death, oh death on such a scale.
PRESIDENT: And if we act to stop it, we shall have to lower the transduction barriers first. We shall be at the Dalek's mercy.
BLACK: [OC]: Soon the effect will be beyond containment.
PRESIDENT: Doctor. Doctor, what are we to do?
DOCTOR: What can we do? Either the entire universe falls to the Daleks or is reduced to a flaming canker. Either way, it's the end of everything!

elements.text: [Part Four]
[OC]: You must act immediately to contain the effect.
With every second we delay, countless lives on innumerable worlds are lost, devoured.
[OC]: This is Vansell. Lord President, Doctor, we're in trouble.
Vansell, is Evelyn all right?
[OC]: The Daleks have got us trapped in section twelve.
But there isn't time! You don't
Every second we delay
Vansell, I'm on my way. Lord President, look after Romana.
But the Daleks, Doctor. The effect. There's no time
We can't just leave them! I'll be back as soon as I can.
Exchange of weapons fire.
We'll never hold them.
Never mind holding them, we've got to find a way through them.
We're sitting ducks out here.
That masonry. Behind it, quick.
What? That wouldn't shelter a starving field mouse.
It's all we have. Aim for the eye stalks.
My vision is impaired. I cannot see. Emergency.
(sotto) One down, twenty to go. What's that smoke?
Steam. They must have ruptured the water supply.
Make us harder to find.
2: Surrender to the Daleks. Obey!
Was that the door?
Not sure. Can't see a thing. There's too much smoke.
That Dalek you shot in the eye.
It's coming for us.
Emergency!
Well, don't just hide there, help me steer this thing back that way, against the Daleks.
Doctor!
You heard him. That's our shield. Use it to get to the doors.
Motive units malfunctioning. Exterminate!
Pretty dangerous shield.
Come on, Dalek, move. We've no time for this.
2: Under attack. Crush all resistance.
That's it, push it faster.
Evelyn, Trinkett, the doors are open. Get through them before the Daleks realise, quick.
Behind me, Evelyn.
Like hiding behind a rake. For heaven's sake, girl, get out of the way and follow me.
2: Do not move.
Reldath, Vansell, one more push should do it.
Under attack.
Run!
2: Exterminate.
Dalek dies.
Door closed.
Doctor, you saved our lives.
Come on.
You don't seem very pleased.
Pleased? The Daleks are setting the entire cosmos alight. And if we try to contain the fire, the Daleks will simply stroll in here, take control, and start the killing all over again.
There's just no answer to that.
What? Doctor. Doctor, wait.
What did he mean? Setting light to the cosmos?
I should go after him.
Wait, Evelyn, please. It's time to face facts. I think we all know there are no reinforcements coming now.
We're all that stands in the way of the Daleks?
There's three more bulkheads between here and the Council chamber. Evelyn, if we move that way, and you lock the doors behind us, that will delay the Daleks for a while.
All right.
Then we'll dig in. When the Daleks do come, we'll fire in concentrated bursts. Now, they advance in lines, so, so you three men take the far left, you two the centre, and Trinkett
I'll take the right, shall 1, Commander Reldath?
The effect of the element is growing exponentially from the galaxy centre. Rate of destruction is, Gallifrey relative, eighteen light years per second.
Is the destruction radial?
Yes, and exceeds our predictions by twenty three percent.
In six hours, galaxy one seven A five three destroyed.
And the effect uncontainable.
Alert our forces. They must take the Council chamber at any cost.
Door opens and closes.
All right, that's the last of them locked and bolted.
You sure you won't stay with us?
I'm sorry, Trinkett. I won't have anyone dying over me. I'm going to try and help the Doctor.
Distant Dalek weapons.
Take care, Evelyn.
You too, dear. You too.
(distant) The door is weakening. Advance!
Now you know all that we do, Vansell.
Why are the Daleks doing this? They're twisted, hostile, but they fight to prolong their survival. To concoct a scheme like this
I know. It makes no sense.
Romana groans.
Lord President, check on Romana. Can I get a map of the Capitol from this thing?
Yes, here.
Oh!
Careful, my dear.
Come on, Romana. I need you.
I, I'm fine now. Sorry, Doctor. I simply couldn't contain the detonation charge.
Oh, don't blame yourself. You did everything you could.
Doctor, what are you doing?
Checking the route through to the Eye of Harmony.
The only possible means of controlling the effect.
We can get started on the process with the barriers still up.
That's true. We need only lower them when, when the time comes.
We'll need a formidable array of modulatory controls for it to adapt its power for use in this way.
You'll need the Great Sash, Doctor, and the Rod of Rassilon.

We'll need the everything of Rassilon, Lord President, right down to his purple polka dot pyjamas. Now, Vansell, let me tell you the things I'll need. Telepathically, I think. It's quite a list. Contact?
Contact.
All right?
I'll see what I can do.
Now, where's Evelyn? You'll need her to get about while I use the mock-up ID.
Door opens.
Oh, there you are, Doctor.
And there you are, Vansell. Guard her with your life.
Come on, Evelyn. We need to get to the Operations centre.
Oh dear. Am I the incredible walking key again?
The running key. Go! Quickly.
Nice seeing you, too.
Evelyn, come on.
Footsteps, door closes.
Lord President, stay here and keep an eye on the effect. We need you to keep us updated.
I understand, Doctor.
Romana? Time to go to the Eye of Harmony.
I'd offer to help, but I've no idea what a hyplisic incubator looks like.
Epsilon reticular gauge.
Or one of them, yes. (sighs) What do you think's going to happen?
Either the destructive effect is uncontrollable and we all die, or else we contain the effect but in lowering the transduction barriers the Daleks get in.
And we still die. Cheerful thought.
No sense in fooling ourselves. If we could only get to a Tardis, we could escape back in Time.
But the Daleks hold that place where you keep all your Tardises.
Just as they did on Archetryx. We can't evacuate a single soul. They're working to a tried and tested plan. There's something I'm missing, I know it.
Well, here we are. The Vault of the Eye of Harmony. Let's get unpacked.
The atmosphere here. You can feel the power, can't you?
The secret power of a syphoned singularity, the sacred heart of the Time Lords.
And we're reducing it to the equivalent of an electric socket.

Well, that's all it is when you strip away the mystical mumbo-jumbo. A phenomenal power source. Come on, get the Sash rigged up. I'll construct the generator loops. If we can only harness the energies of the Eye.
And use them to power the gravitron, enabling it to an area far larger than it was designed to hold.
And if luck is very much on our side
Then there is a slim chance we might contain the effect. What are we really doing? If we
prove this lash-up will work, only to let the Daleks just glide in and take it, we're just prolonging the universe's agony.
We're saving lives.
So they can be lived out under threat of death from the Daleks?
So they have the choice. Let's get on with it.
Listen to that. It sounds like the Daleks are throwing themselves against the doors.
Mmm. Quite frantic, aren't they?
Wait. Those explosions we heard.
That self-destruction thing they did back on Archetryx? Of course. They must be doing more damage to the doors that way.
Less Daleks to deal with, I suppose.
Shows you how confident they are of victory. Or how desperate they're starting to become.
Calling the Castellan. Emergency Council, respond please.
Static.
Please?
[OC]: Time Lords, we are blocking your communications. You will hear us.
What is it you want, Dalek?
[OC]: The reaction is spreading faster than predicted. There is insufficient time to contain it without Dalek assistance.
You must take us for fools.
[OC]: You will lower the transduction barrier.
I will not be your slave, Dalek. We have nothing more to discuss.
Door opens and closes. Footsteps.
Vansell, Evelyn. You were successful?
I patched through the gravitron controls to the Eye chamber.
And if that power will not suffice?
The Doctor thinks we can rig up some boosting equipment. A lot of the parts are stored in sector five.
It will take you some time to reach there.
We thought we'd take this lot to the Doctor first.
Hurry. Even the Daleks have underestimated the force they've unleashed.
They told you that?
They said the only way to contain it was to let them help us. And if, if they're telling the truth.
They'd say anything to make you let them in.
You're right, of course.
Of course I'm right. Now come along. Open sesame!
Door opens.
You are right. You have to be.
The couplings are holding.

Good. Let's hope they'll hold the charge from this little lash-up. You'd better feed the figures through to the President. Tell him what power levels we can achieve, then his computers can work how much time we have left before, well, before this ends one way or the other. Perhaps while they're at it, they can work out how many lives we can still save, how many worlds we might keep hanging in cold dark space before the firestorm hits and they're all gone forever.
Doctor, I understand how you're feeling, but we have to remain objective, stay detached.
Be true to our heritage? Remain emotionless observers.
Of we let emotion cloud our judgement, and we make a mistake
All right. All right, yes.
I'll give the President our estimates. (beeps) Lord President, I have some figures for you.
Door opens.
Evelyn and Vansell, at last. What kept you?
I had to cannibalise three different machines for some of those parts.
Give them here.
(words uncertain)
No choice. Now, this should do for a first run. Romana, help me. Powering up. Vansell, this panel here approximates the gravitron console in the Operations complex? Right, good. Here we go then.
We've run no proper tests.
There's no time to do this by the book.
What book? Half the science we've used is nonsense.
No change there, then. Increasing power.
Lord President, are you registering the power build?
[OC]: I am. Range achieved. Enlarge the energy field.
Here's the tricky bit.
Field radial diameter expanding to ninety thousand light years.
That's big, isn't it?
It's too much. Far too much. The Eye won't cope.
There's no other way.
[OC]: You must hurry. The effect has almost exceeded that boundary.
Romana?
Feeding through auxiliary power.
She's taking it.
Must you anthropomorphise every piece of machinery you come across?
Converting the power. Yes! Yes! She's holding.
Oh, well done, Doctor.
No! Output destabilising.
Steady. Come on now. Don't loose it.
It's no good. The flux comparator's shorting out.
No, no, we can siill
Doctor, we'll blow ourselves to smithereens if you don't power down.
Powering down.
[OC]: Boundaries exceeded. The effect remains uncontained.
I'll get started on repairs.
Bah! Worthless machine.
Well, kicking the thing's not going to do it
I need the boosters. Why have you not gone for them?
We're going for them now. Doctor, I've never seen you so upset.
You can't take it in, can you? Oh, the blessing of a human mind.
Well, if you're going to be all high and mighty.

It's a matter of perspective, Evelyn. Let's take your own galaxy, the Milky Way. An area of space so vast that if it were reduced to the size of the United States of America, the Earth would be less than the smallest mote of dust, barely visible through an electron microscope.
Oh.
Doctor.

Seriphia is four times as large as the Milky Way, and in just a few hours six hundred billion stars will be as snuffed out candles to a new sun, a ball of fire four hundred thousand light years across. And from there it will spread on and on and on through the hundred billion other galaxies in the universe. The death toll will be as incalculable as it will be absolute. And by the end there'll be nothing left! Nothing!
You've made your point, Doctor.
All right, Doctor. I understand. I'm sorry. I'm sorry, all right?
No. No, Evelyn. No, /'m sorry.
We can still stop the Daleks, can't we?
Of course we can. And we will. I'd better help Romana with the repairs.
Come on, Vansell. Let's get the man what he needs.
Good luck, Doctor.
Door opens and closes.
Good luck, Vansell? Things really are serious.
While you were waxing lyrical, the President gave me the results of the equations.
And?
The effect's moving faster. I reckon that even with the boosters configured, we've got less than an hour before the destruction outstrips our capacity to contain it.
Less than an hour. Come on, we have to be ready.
(sotto) No time. No time at all. May my people forgive me for what I am to do. (loud) Black Dalek, this is the President of Gallifrey.
[OC]: Speak.
As you say, the effect is spiralling out of control. I don't believe you wish to perish, but I need proof of your good intent. I will not leave Gallifrey defenceless without a show of trust.
[OC]: Continue.

Order your Dalek forces here to self-destruct. If you do so, I will place my own life in your hands. I will be your willing prisoner, and will allow a limited unarmed Dalek scientific presence through the transduction barriers in my own ship.
[OC]: These terms are unacceptable.
Consider them, Dalek, or die with the rest of us.
[OC]: These are the Dalek's terms.
Go on.
How's the flux comparator doing now?
Hard to say. It's changing.
Let me see. Hmm. So it does. Oh, that's flux for you.
Now what?
We calibrate the range so it's as broad as we dare, and try again. Where have Vansell and Evelyn got to with those parts?
Everywhere's so deserted.
Evacuated.
Where to?
I don't know. The north, perhaps? There was never any provision for catastrophe like this. It has happened so easily.
Well, you'll know for next time. Oh, these things weigh a ton. Don't you have, I don't know, robotic drones or something to do the heavy lifting?
Only primitives depend on robots.
You'd save yourself a lot of hernias.
Noise off.
What was that?
What?
Listen. You are certain this part of the Capitol's been evacuated?
You have done well, Commander Reldath.
You must get to shelter. It's not safe here.
Don't tell me you've got a taste for the front line now?
It is my duty to speak to the Daleks.
But Lord President.

The Daleks claim they want to help us. Time is running out, and we must do all we can. I've spoken with the Black Dalek, who has given me his word that his Daleks won't harm us and will submit to disarmament.
Disarmament? What, provided we let them through first?
They will then proceed to help the Doctor.
After all the Daleks have done, you'd trust them? The Doctor said they'd set the universe alight.
And the Doctor and Romana have tried already to contain the effect. They have failed, and I have grave doubts of any further attempts proving successful if not aided.
But you don't have grave doubts about dealing with Daleks.
The Daleks have one urge that is as strong as their impulse to conquer, and that is to survive. If the universe should perish, so too will the Daleks.
Bang, crash.
They're almost through.
Good. They will find me waiting. I will go to meet them, alone.
But you can't, Lord President.
I have agreed it with the Black Dalek. I must make the show of trust myself. If I am wrong in this, and if the Daleks should kill me, continue to defend Gallifrey, Commander Reldath, until the end.
Footsteps.
We can't let him do this.
Come on, we'll follow.
Scraping noise.
There it is again. That noise.
I heard it too.
Well, quite.
(distant) Do not move.
Daleks! Here?
When the Doctor opened the doors to save us, one of them must have got through and doubled round behind.
(distant) You will surrender to the Daleks.
Run. Come on, round the corner.
(distant) Halt, or you will be exterminated.
Weapons fire.
My leg!
Evelyn, you have to get up.
I can't. I can't even feel my leg, let alone move it.
Proximity to the Dalek ray. The paralysis should pass.
Very reassuring.
If the Daleks get hold of you, they'll have to anywhere on Gallifrey.

Look, Vansell. That Dalek is on his own, and he's armed. He'd need some kind of, I don't know, butcher's knife to cut my eyes out like that other poor fellow. Therefore he'll need to keep me alive. And while I'm alive, I'm safe. Reasonably. But if the Doctor doesn't get these boosters. Here, can you manage?
I'll have to. All right, the Dalek's coming. Delay it for as long as you can.
Halt! Halt!
You mustn't mind him, he's hard of hearing.
Exterminate.
No, no, don't. Don't. It's my eyes that the security scans respond to. My eyes.
Verify what you Say is true.
I will. Oh. I will, if I can walk. Ow!
Rise!
Sorry, Doctor.
Rise!
You could help a girl up, Dalek. A pretty face like mine could open a lot of doors for you.
Bulkhead door opens, footsteps.
You are the President of the Time Lords?
That is correct. You see, Daleks? I am keeping my side of the bargain I have made with your leader. The Black Dalek has assured me that you will disarm. Allow me to disassemble your weapons.
We submit.
Thank you.
All right, Dalek. Here we go. Are you watching carefully? I simply place my eye here.
Burbles and beeps, door opens.
And hey presto. Oh, hang on, his crystal's glowing. Must be having a natter. (Dalek) Yes, I picked up this Earth female with the most astounding eyes.
Dalek scout to troop leader. Retina override now in Dalek control. Access to Council chamber now assured.
Your weapon, Dalek. Release it. (clicks) Thank you. I acknowledge the trust you show in allowing me your weapon. That crystal under your casing is glowing. What are you
We no longer require Gallifrey's cooperation. Exterminate!
What?
Lord President.
Dalek weapon fires. The President cries out.
No!
He's dead, Reldath. There's nothing we can do.
We can grab that Dalek's gun.
(distant) Exterminate!
With pleasure!
Weapon fires, boom, Dalek gurgles.
Well done, Reldath.
(distant) Advance.
Come on, you must leave him. Fall back!
Gallifrey will fall to the Daleks. Advance. Crush resistance.
Running stops.
No way of locking the doors now. What can we do now? Where can we go?
The Doctor's our last chance. We must try to get to the Eye of Harmony. Come on.
The Council chamber has been taken. Transduction barrier shut down. Squad proceeding to the Eye of Harmony.
All units prepare to mobilise. Gallifrey belongs to the Daleks!
Well?
I think we're about there.
I can't get through to the President.
We need to know our parameters. Without him monitoring
I'll go.
Door opens.
Evelyn!. Evelyn, you're safe.
And sorry.
Sorry?
Do not move.
Well, if we don't move, then very soon you and everything else will cease to exist, so maybe under the circumstance, hmm?
You will await Dalek orders.
Oh, with bated breath. Do you mind moving out of the doorway? You're blocking my light.
Weapon fires, Dalek gurgles.
How very cooperative.
What in the world? Oh, it's you, Trinkett.
And Reldath. I'm so pleased you're all right.
We followed you all the way here. So that's the Eye. It's so huge! Incredible.
Imagine it with a bit of mascara.
Power up, Romana.
I must get to the President in the Council chamber.
I wouldn't bother. The Daleks are right behind us, and the President's dead.
What?
The Daleks betrayed him.
Dead? No.
One more life lost.
Doctor, without the President to shut off the transduction barriers when the power reaches critical
I know, I know. But let's reach that point first, shall we? If the Daleks have taken control
It's only a matter of time before they come for us.
Energy building. Feeding in the boosters now.
That's a frightening amount of power.
Time to give it a focus. Open the Eye of Harmony.
The eye scan's not. Doctor, it's not working.
What?
Oh, of course. Evelyn, it's your doing. Stand over by that pillar, and when the light shines up, look into it.
Give me a moment.
To think, a human, opening the Eye of Harmony.
OR! It is bright, isn't it.
The Eye's opening. The energy!
Power still building.
I can feel it. Even with the Sash diffusing its energies, I can fee/ it. Warming, stirring. Are you sure we can control this?
We have to control it. We have to jolt three hundred thousand light years of space just that tiniest fraction of a second into the future.
This place is going to come crashing round our ears.
All of you, into the corner. Take whatever shelter you can.
The Daleks will be here any moment.
Your sense of timing, young lady, leaves a lot to be desired.
The Dalek ship. They're materialising here.
Door opens.
Hurry, Romana.
These readings. Doctor, we don't have enough power.
We must do. We're so close. We can't fail now.
Look at these figures. It's no good. We can't bridge the energy shortfall.
We'll give it everything.
That is everything.
Look out, you two. Daleks!
It must be a full invasion force. They'll kill us.
It's all over.
That one there, is that their leader?
Yes, the Black Dalek himself. Get back against the wall. The other Daleks, they're here too.
Oh dear. Do you think they'll kill us all?
Proceed. Join main party. Observe.
We obey.
Looks like they've got better things to do.
We'll find out soon enough.
Doctor.
Well, well, here you are.
You have not contained the effect.
And you've signed the death warrant for the entire universe.
Move away from the controls.
Or you'll do what? The threat of death isn't a very strong one right now. Your Apocalypse element will engulf us all before long.
Oh, get off me, Dalek! Oh, all right, all right, you can have the controls.
Enlarging radius of containment field.
Futile. There just isn't enough power. It's as simple as that.
You have the transference crystal.
That's right.
Take it from her.
No, keep away from me.
Romana, here, give it to me. Howzat!
Advance on the Doctor.
Door opens.
Look at them all, gathered round him like bullies. What are they doing?
They're going to push him into the Eye.
No!
What are you doing?
The power of the Eye of Harmony can be boosted with Dalek mental energy.
A cupful of water in an ocean.
It will suffice. Daleks, begin.
Explosions, the Doctor yelping.
The energy, it's indescribable!
The heat from all those Dalek crystals.
Doctor, the power levels are rising.
What?
Still climbing. Doctor, critical level almost achieved!
The Eye of Harmony. Throw the transference crystal into the Eye.
Now!
Everybody down!
KaBOOM! then silence.
We're still here.
The Daleks. Are they all dead? What's happened?
I'm going to the Council chamber. We have to know for sure.
Footsteps.
Whatever happened, the Daleks did it.

They must have had a thousand Dalek minds focussed in that crystal by the end. Each one pouring in every scintilla of their life essence to boost the power. Look at them. Drained dry. They overestimated Gallifreyan technology and underestimated the power of the element they'd created.
(weak) No, Doctor. We prepared the crystal for such an eventuality.
It's alive.
Only just.
[OC]: Vansell, this is Romana.
Go on.
[OC]: The scanner confirms it. Seriphia is all but consumed by the fireball, but the effect has been contained.
Oh, my goodness.
Yes! Oh, well done, Doctor.
It's over. It's over.
To the end, Lord President.
All those lives. So many magical worlds I'll never know.
Doctor, wait. The time field around Seriphia won't be stable.
Seems the Daleks have thought of that, too. Look at the readings here. Before the Dalek operator died, it set time within the containment field into acceleration.
Allowing the effect to run its course.
[OC]: It, it's incredible! Even as I watch, the effect is dying away, and in its place is new matter. Nebulae, stars, planets. The building blocks of a new galaxy, they're all forming.
Life from death. You hear that, Dalek? Life wins.
No, Doctor. We knew the weapon to be too dangerous and unstable to be used to destroy a galaxy. But we have created a galaxy, one the Daleks are poised to invade.
What?
No!
A galaxy the Daleks will occupy without resistance. We shall rule over a million Skaros, Doctor. We shall form a power base from which the Daleks will become the supreme power of the universe.
You gambled with the universe simply to propagate your endless war against it.
Life falls. The Daleks have attained victory.
Weapon fires, boom!
No, you'll never win!
Trinkett, do you think you could put down the Dalek gunstick now? Is that it now?
(sighs) This battle is over, at last.
Good. Because in that case, I think you could do with a little sit-down.
All Gallifreyans. The state of emergency is ended. The High Council are meeting shortly. Further instructions will follow. We repeat. The state of emergency is ended.
I'm relieved to hear it. And relieved to see the Tardis again too.

Indeed. (pats the Tardis) But don't look too closely. With the very trace of your eye scan still lingering in the security matrices, who knows what effect you could have on the old girl. Come on, time we were slipping away.
Time for a good long rest. (footsteps) Look out, the boss has seen you skiving.
Doctor? You're not leaving, surely? There's so much to be done.
And I'm sure you'll do it splendidly, Madam President. Even with Vansell here still doing his best to mess things up.
You mess up half the planet, Doctor, and leave just as the clearing up begins.
Well, I've got my own cleaning up to do. Reldath has checked out Archetryx for me.
The devastation was extreme, but there are survivors, just as there are on the Monan Host world.
That's wonderful.
And much to Vrint's delight, I'm sure. Do you need a lift?
Reldath is taking me.
Ah.
Romana, you will help these worlds recover, won't you?
I will, Doctor. Just as I'll ensure Seriphia doesn't fall to the Daleks. Gallifrey will not tolerate a Dalek Empire on its doorstep. We'll never be defenceless again.
Well, here's to survivors the universe over.
Life does win, whatever the Daleks may say.

parts.searchable_dialogue:
BLACK: [OC]: You must act immediately to contain the effect.
DOCTOR: With every second we delay, countless lives on innumerable worlds are lost, devoured.
VANSELL: [OC]: This is Vansell. Lord President, Doctor, we're in trouble.
DOCTOR: Vansell, is Evelyn all right?
VANSELL: [OC]: The Daleks have got us trapped in section twelve.
DOCTOR: But there isn't time! You don't
PRESIDENT: Every second we delay
DOCTOR: Vansell, I'm on my way. Lord President, look after Romana.
PRESIDENT: But the Daleks, Doctor. The effect. There's no time
DOCTOR: We can't just leave them! I'll be back as soon as I can.
RELDATH: We'll never hold them.
VANSELL: Never mind holding them, we've got to find a way through them.
EVELYN: We're sitting ducks out here.
TRINKETT: That masonry. Behind it, quick.
EVELYN: What? That wouldn't shelter a starving field mouse.
VANSELL: It's all we have. Aim for the eye stalks.
DALEK: My vision is impaired. I cannot see. Emergency.
EVELYN: (sotto) One down, twenty to go. What's that smoke?
